primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must construct a 'storm-proof' religion to survive the tribulations of life by utilizing Jesus as a resource.

tekstueel_bewijs: We must have religion steeped in a faith which can withstand the stress
We can build a storm-proof religion
You can test your faith by whether or not it can stand stress
a faith that is stress resistant
religion that can stand stress and does not collapse
the command of life is to always keep moving
I have come with the formula
allow you to have religion that is storm-proof
talking to the Lord through constant prayer
Jesus was on board... the first element in this formula

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as external 'stress' or 'circumstances' that cause internal collapse, rather than radical Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Biblical story of Jesus calming the storm.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The biblical narrative (where Jesus is Subject) is used merely as an 'ingredient' or 'formula' for the hearer's primary program of self-strengthening.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord can speak peace to our souls
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can build a storm-proof religion
You need to cultivate the prayer habit

voorbeelden: You need to look for some other way
I want to follow an incident
the thing you want least to be
I have come with the formula
you need enough presence of mind
give you the power to overcome

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily driven by obligation (Devoir) and knowledge of a technique (Savoir). It assumes the hearer has the inherent power if they simply apply the 'formula'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Collapse) to ~S1 (Hothouse) to S1 (Stability) via the 'Formula'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the hearer's successful application of prayer and 'having Jesus on board'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a psychological failure of 'metal fatigue' rather than a spiritual state of lostness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While Jesus is mentioned frequently, he is positioned as a 'Helper' (Adjuvant) to the human 'Subject' who is building a 'storm-proof religion'. The focus is on the hearer's performance of the formula.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus was on board. That's the first element in this formula.
If you have the Lord on board, you're in good condition.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He sweated our sweat, drank our water... felt our loneliness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are used as a model for 'having sense enough to call him'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The story is about Christ's sovereign power over creation, which he exercises despite the disciples' lack of faith.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'formula' correctly to avoid 'wilting'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is reduced to a coping mechanism for life's stresses.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent as a 'self-help' guide but creates tension by calling Jesus 'Lord' while treating Him as a tool.
spanning_punten: Jesus as Sovereign vs. Jesus as 'Ingredient #1'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I have come with the formula that will allow you to have religion that is storm-proof.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The preacher provides the 'Savoir-faire' (formula) instead of the Spirit providing 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is framed as 'metal fatigue' or 'collapsing under stress' rather than rebellion against God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a manual for human construction. The hearer is the Subject; Jesus is the Helper; the Object is personal resilience.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one building the 'storm-proof' life.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Jesus is the Subject who builds the house/faith; the hearer is the Receiver.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We can build a storm-proof religion,' use 'Christ builds in us a faith that he himself sustains.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'experienced seaman' who must call out.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'perishing' one who is saved despite their panic.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the disciples' failure and Christ's unilateral action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (God's power) and Vouloir (God's desire to save).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on Christ's 'Hush' as an effective word that creates what it commands, regardless of the hearer's 'formula'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: The 'Chaos' of the sea as a symbol of death and the demonic.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'stress', we only need a therapist. If the opponent is 'Death', we need a Savior.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (building religion) precedes Soteriology (Jesus as a helper).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ calms the storm (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, we rest in Him (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has great rhetorical energy but risks leaving the hearer exhausted by the task of 'building' their own security.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is powerful and uses vivid metaphors. Semiotically, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note the 'Who is this?' question in Mark; this sermon ignores Christology for the sake of 'Application'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that Jesus is not the hero of this sermon; the 'Storm-proof Religion' is the hero, and the hearer is the builder.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the '747' and 'Lake Malawi' illustrations to emphasize the 'testing' of the human subject.
